Description: Bone inlay; carved from animal-bone with polished surfaces; decorated with a stylised vine-scroll; pierced with a circular rivet hole through the centre; fragment.
Curator's comments: This belongs to a distinctive class of object which probably begins in the Late Roman/Byzantine period and certainly continues into the early Islamic period. They are well known from Egypt, e.g. from excavations at Fustat (M. Kawatoko & Y. Shindo, 'Artifacts of the Medieval Islamic Period Excavated in al-Fustat, Egypt', Waseda University 2010, p.9, col. pl. 11.15).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 1927,0318.34 (when registered again in G&R)
